title: Wrexham vs Torquay live updates
body_text:
How Wrexham drew 1-1 with Torquay in final match of National League season for Ryan Reynolds & Rob McElhenney's club
Summary
Wrexham have drawn 1-1 with Torquay United in the final match of the National League season.
Having confirmed their promotion to the Football League last week, the champions finish the season with a record 111 points, while Torquay are relegated.
Wrexham’s week as champions: Drunken dancing, late-night pizza and a Ferris wheel ride
Wrexham sealed their return to the Football League last weekend, but what happened next?
Here’s the story of a week in the life of the newly-crowned champions, featuring drunken dancing, late-night pizza and a Ferris wheel ride!
Richard Sutcliffe has it all and more below.
Foster's farewell?
Ben Foster, who came out of retirement last month to join Wrexham, has yet to confirm whether he'll come back for another year in goal.
Either way, the impact he made in just a few games will be remembered for a long time in Wales.
Ryan Reynolds: 'Next season starts now'
Campeones
Rob McElhenney: 'We're just getting started'
National League play-offs
As the season is wrapped up, we know which teams will be battling in the play-offs for a place in League Two alongside Wrexham.
By finishing second and third respectively, Notts County and Chesterfield have secured passage directly into the semi-finals.
Woking, Barnet, Boreham Wood and Bromley are the teams that will meet in the quarter-finals.
Quarter-finals:
- Woking vs Bromley
- Barnet vs Boreham Wood
Semi-finals:
- Notts County vs Barnet/Boreham Wood
- Chesterfield vs Woking/Bromley
The final will take place at Wembley, while the preceding matches will be hosted by the higher-seeded club.
Langstaff pips Mullin to top scorer title
Wrexham's Paul Mullin finished the season with an impressive tally of 38 goals in 46 National League matches, but it wasn't enough to top the division's scoring chart.
Macaulay Langstaff of Notts County scored his 42nd of the season today, earning the plaudits. Perhaps most impressively, none of Langstaff's goals were penalty kicks.
Today's National League results
Other than the Aldershot-Altrincham game that was delayed, the National League season is over.
Here are today's results:
- Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
- Gateshead 4-0 Maidenhead
- Barnet 0-2 Dagenham & Redbridge
- Boreham Wood 1-0 Yeovil
- Chesterfield 4-0 Maidstone
- Dorking 2-1 Scunthorpe
- Halifax 1-1 Eastleigh
- Notts County 1-1 York City
- Oldham 1-1 Bromley
- Solihull Moors 0-1 Woking
- Southend 2-1 Wealdstone
- Aldershot 0-0 Altrincham (61')
A record-extending draw for Wrexham
They weren't able to add three points to their National League tally today, but a draw means Wrexham have still made their British points record slightly harder to beat for teams in the future.
Spare a thought for Notts County, whose 107 points does not even guarantee them a promotion place - they will now go into the play-offs.
Heartbreak for Torquay
Going into the final day needing a miracle against the champions gave Torquay the highest possible mountain to climb.
On the balance of play, they can probably count themselves unlucky to only have earned a draw.
But, with Gateshead beating Maidenhead 4-0, they would have needed to win by three goals, which was beyond them.
FT: Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
It's all over! Wrexham's time in the National League has come to a close after 15 years.
Torquay United are relegated, allowing Maidenhead United to remain in the division.
Wrexham goal disallowed
90+3' Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
Wrexham look to have scored a goal that would truly confirm Torquay's relegation, but the flag goes up for offside, sparing them for at least another minute.
INJURY TIME
90+2' Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
We're nearly halfway through four minutes of injury time here. Torquay need a goal and a miracle.
Torquay knocking on the door again
90+1' Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
This has been a spirited performance from Torquay and, on today's evidence, it's hard to see how they're anywhere near the relegation zone — they have caused the champions some real problems.
Another goal for Gateshead provides a new glimmer of hope but it just looks like a bridge too far for Torquay.
They left themselves with far too much to do on the final day.
As things stand, Torquay need a miracle
90' Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
Torquay need some injury time magic to avoid relegation.
Gateshead have increased their lead over Maidenhead to 4-0, meaning Torquay need three goals to survive: at least one Torquay goal and two more by either Torquay or Gateshead.
Chance for Torquay
89' Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
Jarvis nearly has a golden chance right in front of goal, but he can't reach the ball in time before Foster collects it.
Sub for Torquay
87' Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
McGavin comes on for Lapslie.
That could be the goal that sends Torquay down
83' Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
That goal has got the Wrexham supporters bouncing again, and it has knocked the stuffing out of the Torquay fans.
The slip from Lawrence gave the champions a 2v1 in the penalty area and Lee was never going to miss with an open goal at his mercy.
Torquay's task has just gone from very difficult to nearly impossible.
GOAL! Wrexham equalise!
80' Torquay 1-1 Wrexham
Lee scores to level the match and Torquay's dream of surviving relegation may have just ended!
A slip from Lawrence allowed Palmer to break free down the right wing before he found Lee all alone in the box.
